xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9 http://www.loc.gov/ead/ead.xsd">arms_1977_583_ditmars_duryeeGuide to the John Ditmars and Jacob Duryee enslaved woman bill of sale 1977.583Collection processed by Nicholas PavlikThis collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.Brooklyn Historical SocietyBrooklyn Historical Society128 Pierrepont StreetBrooklyn 11201718-222-4111library@brooklynhistory.org
change to complete_collection_levelThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2021-01-13T15:30:20engDescribing Archives: A Content StandardDecember 2020
Revised by Amy Lau, Archivist, to remediate oppressive language from title, finding aid title, preferred citation, abstract, and scope and contents note.
Brooklyn Historical Society
John Ditmars and Jacob Duryee enslaved woman bill of sale
Ditmars, John
Duryee, Jacob
1977.583
0.01 Linear Feet in one folder.
1825 Bill of sale for Sine (b. 1817), an enslaved African American woman, from John Ditmars of the town of Flatlands, Kings County, to Jacob Duryee of the town of Flatbush. The bill is dated June 16, 1825. John Ditmars was commander of the Third Regiment of the New York State Militia from 1811 to 1814. A0072
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); John Ditmars and Jacob Duryee enslaved woman bill of sale, 1977.583, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Biographical Note
John Ditmars was commander of the Third Regiment of the New York State Militia from 1811 to 1814.
Scope and Contents
Bill of sale for transfer of Sine (b. 1817), an enslaved African American woman, from John Ditmars of the town of Flatlands, Kings County, to Jacob Duryee of the town of Flatbush. The bill is dated June 16, 1825.
Processing Information
Oppressive descriptive language was remediated from the title, finding aid title, preferred citation, abstract, and scope and contents notes in this finding aid as part of an anti-racist descriptive language audit performed in December 2020. The title of the related accession, EAD ID and location were not remediated.
Flatlands (New York, N.Y.) Flatbush (New York, N.Y.) Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) Slavery |z New York (State) |z Kings County Bills of sale Ditmars, John Duryee, Jacob
